channel.title: Oil and gas on Logotyp.us
channel.description: Recent content in Oil and gas on Logotyp.us

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Bharat Petroleum Logo Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited is an Indian government-owned oil and gas corporation. It is under the ownership of Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, Government of India, headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra. It operates two large refineries in Kochi and Mumbai. India’s second-largest downstream oil company, it was ranked 309th on the 2020 Fortune list of the world’s biggest corporations, and 792nd on Forbes’s 2021 “Global 2000” list. Source
You can download theBharat Petroleumlogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Bharat Petroleum
item.description: Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited is an Indian government-owned oil and gas corporation. It is under the ownership of Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, Government of India, headquartered in Mumbai, Maharashtra. It operates two large refineries in Kochi and Mumbai. India’s second-largest downstream oil company, it was ranked 309th on the 2020 Fortune list of the world’s biggest corporations, and 792nd on Forbes’s 2021 “Global 2000” list. Source

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Hindustan Petroleum Logo
Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited is a subsidiary of Oil and Natural Gas Corporation with its headquarters in Mumbai, Maharashtra. It has a 25% market-share in India among public sector undertakings coupled with a strong marketing infrastructure. Its parent company is ONGC which owns a majority stake in the company. The company is ranked 367th on the Fortune Global 500 list of the world’s biggest corporations as of 2016. HPCL was removed from NIFTY 50 INDEX in March 2019 On 24 October 2019, the company became a Maharatna PSU.
You can download theHindustan Petroleumlogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Hindustan Petroleum
item.description: Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited is a subsidiary of Oil and Natural Gas Corporation with its headquarters in Mumbai, Maharashtra. It has a 25% market-share in India among public sector undertakings coupled with a strong marketing infrastructure. Its parent company is ONGC which owns a majority stake in the company. The company is ranked 367th on the Fortune Global 500 list of the world’s biggest corporations as of 2016. HPCL was removed from NIFTY 50 INDEX in March 2019 On 24 October 2019, the company became a Maharatna PSU.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Indian Oil Logo
Indian Oil Corporation Limited, d/b/a IndianOil, is an Indian government-owned oil and gas corporation. It is under the ownership of Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, Government of India headquartered in New Delhi. It is the largest commercial oil company in the country, with a net profit of ₹43,242 crore for the financial year 2020-21. It is ranked 2nd in Fortune India 500 list for year 2020 and 151st in Fortune Global 500 list of world’s largest companies in the year 2020.
You can download theIndian Oillogo on full-version of the page.
]] >
item.title: Indian Oil
item.description: Indian Oil Corporation Limited, d/b/a IndianOil, is an Indian government-owned oil and gas corporation. It is under the ownership of Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas, Government of India headquartered in New Delhi. It is the largest commercial oil company in the country, with a net profit of ₹43,242 crore for the financial year 2020-21. It is ranked 2nd in Fortune India 500 list for year 2020 and 151st in Fortune Global 500 list of world’s largest companies in the year 2020.

item.turbo:content:
<! [CDATA[
Hinduja Group Logo Hinduja Group is an Anglo-Indian transnational conglomerate based in Mumbai, India and headquartered in London, United Kingdom. The group is present in eleven sectors including Automotives, Oil and Specialty Chemicals, Banking and Finance, IT & ITeS, Cyber Security, Healthcare, Trading, Infrastructure Project Development, Media & Entertainment, Power, Real Estate. Source
You can download theHindujalogo on full-version of the page. ]] >
item.title: Hinduja
item.description: Hinduja Group is an Anglo-Indian transnational conglomerate based in Mumbai, India and headquartered in London, United Kingdom.
